text: now a congressional committee
investigating the riot at the u.s
capitol building on january the 6th this
year has issued its first round of
subpoenas amongst those summoned to
appear a former president trump's chief
of staff mark meadows and the political
strategist steve bannon the house of
representatives select committee is
investigating efforts to overturn the
2020 presidential election result which
of course ended with the storming of the
capitol building by supporters of mr
trump i'm joined now by cbs news
correspondent bradley blackburn in new
york bradley thanks for joining us first
of all tell me a little bit more about
the four key figures who've been
subpoenaed
well steven these are some of president
trump's closest advisers you mentioned
the former chief of staff mark meadows
and also the strategist steve bannon but
also included on this list are the
former deputy chief of staff for
communications dan scavino and a defense
department official kashyap patel now
all of these men are described as some
of his most loyal aides and the
committee says they believe they may
have relevant information about the
lead-up to the insurrection stephen is
this about uh both getting them there in
person and also getting documentation
and communication records from them what
exactly
does this investigation committee want
that's right it wants them to produce
documents and to appear at depositions
starting in mid-october this committee
has already been pouring through
thousands of pages of documents that it
received in august from the government
and also from social media companies so
now they're going to start this
interview process they are interested in
bannon for instance because he was
apparently urging president trump to
focus on january 6th and had made
predictions about what might happen that
day meadows was with trump on that day
so all of these men have different
perspectives on the events of january 6
than what led up to it could they
ultimately bradley could they refuse to
testify because i know president trump
has already said that if they call him
or even think about it he's just going
to exercise executive privilege but what
rights do these guys have
well we'll have to see executive
privilege does extend not just to uh the
former president but to people that
served around him now he did issue
president trump did issue a statement
calling the subpoenas highly partisan
and he said that he would fight them on
the grounds of executive privilege
usually a congressional committee like
this would ask for cooperation from
witnesses first but in this case they
say they're prepared to move directly to
compulsory subpoenas but some of these
people have apparently already indicated
that they will cooperate with the
committee stephen all right bradley it's
fascinating stuff we'll keep watching
and thank you for giving us that update
